metadata.Title: CVE-2021-46144 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Roundcube before 1.4.13 and 1.5.x before 1.5.2 allows XSS via an HTML e-mail message with crafted Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) token sequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.5.0+dfsg.1-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
roundcube-core - 1.5.0+dfsg.1-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
roundcube-mysql - 1.5.0+dfsg.1-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
roundcube-pgsql - 1.5.0+dfsg.1-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
roundcube-plugins - 1.5.0+dfsg.1-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.5.0+dfsg.1-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: roundcube package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.0+dfsg.1-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
